it.polimi.se2018.model

Class DraftPool

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.se2018.model.DraftPool

  • public class DraftPool
extends java.lang.Object
    The class represents the dice in the draft pool at a certain moment in the game. It also contains, eventually, the die that must be used by the player while using a specific ToolCard.
    Author:
    michelemarzollo

    • Constructor Detail

      • DraftPool

        public DraftPool(Game game)
        The constructor of the class. When the class is built there is no forced selection: the attribute forcedSelection is set to a non valid value -1.
        Parameters:
        game - The game to which the DraftPool has to be bound.

    • Method Detail

      • getAmount

        public int getAmount()
        Returns the current amount of dice in the draft pool.
        Returns:
        The number of dice currently in the draft pool.

      • getDice

        public java.util.List<Die> getDice()
        The getter for dice.

        A copy of the list is returned, in order not to expose the rep.

        Returns:
        The list dice.

      • setDice

        public void setDice(java.util.List<Die> dice)
        The setter for dice.
        Parameters:
        dice - The new list of dice to set.

      • draft

        public void draft(int index)
        The method to draft a die form the DraftPool.
        Parameters:
        index - the position of the die to draft in the list.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the index is out of range.

      • select

        public Die select(int index)
        The method to select a die from the DraftPool.
        Parameters:
        index - the index of the die to select in the DraftPool.
        Returns:
        the die.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the index is out of range.

      • isPresent

        public boolean isPresent(Colour colour)
        Method that returns true if colour corresponds to at least a Die's colour in draftPool. This method is useful to detect if a ToolCard can be used or not in single player mode: Tool Cards may be used only by spending a Die from the DraftPool that matches the ToolCard's Colour.
        Parameters:
        colour - The colour of the toolCard that the Player is trying to use.
        Returns:
        true if a Die in the draftPool is of the colour requested, false otherwise.
